support.description: Content is actively maintained. Please report errors and inconsistencies

author_blurb.en: Translated for SuttaCentral by Bhikkhu Sujato, 2018. Dedicated to the public domain via Creative Commons Zero (CC0). You are encouraged to copy, reproduce, adapt, alter, or otherwise make use of this translation in any way you wish. Attribution is appreciated but not legally required.

segments.pli: “Yesaṃ kesañci, bhikkhave, ariyo aṭṭhaṅgiko maggo viraddho, viraddho tesaṃ ariyo aṭṭhaṅgiko maggo sammā dukkhakkhayagāmī.
segments.en: “Mendicants, whoever has missed out on the noble eightfold path has missed out on the noble path to the complete ending of suffering.

segments.pli: Yesaṃ kesañci, bhikkhave, ariyo aṭṭhaṅgiko maggo āraddho, āraddho tesaṃ ariyo aṭṭhaṅgiko maggo sammā dukkhakkhayagāmī.
segments.en: Whoever has undertaken the noble eightfold path has undertaken the noble path to the complete ending of suffering.

segments.pli: Katamo ca, bhikkhave, ariyo aṭṭhaṅgiko maggo?
segments.en: And what is the noble eightfold path?
It is right view, right thought, right speech, right action, right livelihood, right effort, right mindfulness, and right immersion.

segments.pli: Yesaṃ kesañci, bhikkhave, ayaṃ ariyo aṭṭhaṅgiko maggo viraddho, viraddho tesaṃ ariyo aṭṭhaṅgiko maggo sammā dukkhakkhayagāmī.
segments.en: Whoever has missed out on the noble eightfold path has missed out on the noble path to the complete ending of suffering.

segments.pli: Yesaṃ kesañci, bhikkhave, ayaṃ ariyo aṭṭhaṅgiko maggo āraddho, āraddho tesaṃ ariyo aṭṭhaṅgiko maggo sammā dukkhakkhayagāmī”ti.
segments.en: Whoever has undertaken the noble eightfold path has undertaken the noble path to the complete ending of suffering.”

suttaplex.blurb: Neglecting the eightfold path you neglect the path to the end of suffering.
